This statistic shows the median age of the population in Lesotho from 1950 to 2050. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the population of Lesotho was 19. years.

This statistic shows data on the degree of inequality in wealth distribution based on the Gini coefficient in Panama between 2000 and 2017. The Gini coefficient measures the deviation of the distribution of income (or consumption) among individuals or households in a given country from from a perfectly equal distribution. A value of 0 represents absolute equality, whereas 100 would be the highest possible degree of inequality. As of 2017, Panama had a Gini coefficient of 5.9, an improvement from 50.9 as of 2012.

In statistic shows the average rate in India from 1985 to 2019, with projections up until 2025. In inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes. This statistic shows the median age of the population in Zambia from 1950 to 2050*.The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Zambian population was 17.7 years.

The statistic shows the growth in India real gross domestic product (GDP) in India from 2015 to 2019,, with projections up until 2025. In refers to the total market value of all goods and services that are produced within a country per year. It is an important indicator of the economic strength of a country. This statistic shows data on the degree of inequality in wealth distribution based on the Gini coefficient in Bolivia between 2000 and 2017. The coefficient measures the deviation of the distribution of income (or consumption) among individuals or households in a given country from a perfectly equal distribution. A value of 0 represents absolute equality, whereas 100 would be the highest possible degree of inequality. As of 2017, Bolivia had a Gini coefficient of 4. an improvement from 5.4 as of 2015.

The statistic showss South Africa's real gross domestic product (GDP) growth rate from 2015 to 2019, with projections up until 2025. In refers to the total market value of all goods and services that are produced within a country per year. It is an important indicator of the economic strength of a country. Real GDP is adjusted for price changes and is therefore regarded as a key indicator for economic growth. In 2019, South Africa's real GDP increased grown by around 1.15 percent compared to the previous year.

In statistic shows the Corruption Perception Index score obtained by El Salvador from 2012 to 2019. In index is a composite indicator that includes data on the perception of corruption in areas such as: bribery of public officials, kickbacks in public procurement, embezzlement of state funds, and effectiveness of government' anti-corruption efforts. It highest possible score in perception of corruption is 0, whereas a score of 100 indicates that no corruption is perceived in the respective country. In 2019, Salvador, the corruption perception index score was from 39 points in 2012 to 39 points in 2019.

This statistic shows the average rate in France from 1985 to 2019, with projections up until 2025. In inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes. In 2019, the average rate in France  at about 0.0.8 percent compared to the previous year.

This statistic presents data on the degree of inequality in wealth distribution based on the Gini coefficient in Chile between 2000 and 2017. The coefficient measures the deviation of the distribution of income (or consumption) among individuals or households in a given country from a perfectly equal distribution. A value of 0 represents absolute equality, whereas 100 would be the highest possible degree of inequality. As of 2017, Chile had a Gini coefficient of 46.6, an improvement from 52.1 as of 2012.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in Jamaica from 1950 to 2050. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Jamaica of Jamaica was 2 years.

This statistic shows the T-indicator-value (TIV) of arms export of arms from Norway in 2018, by country. In TIV is expressedbased on the known unit production costs of a military set of weapons and is intended to represent the transfer of military resources rather than the financial value of the transfer. In TIV is expressed here in million constant U.S. dollars as of 1990. The 2018, the exports Norway to the United States amounted to 20 million constant U90) U.S. dollars. Ted export value is only an indicator and does not correspond to the actual financial value of the transfer.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in Ireland from 1950 to 2050. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Irish population was 30.2 years.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in South Africa from 1950 to 2050..The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the South African population was 23.8 years.
